resources.string: Your library contents will show up here
Storage permissions is required for local media. Click to grant permission.
\"%s\" added to the end of queue
Do you really want to delete the stored lyrics for \"%s\"?
Failed to play song. Only content accessible on YouTube Music can be played
Note: This allows for syncing with YouTube Music. This is NOT changeable later. You cannot add local songs to synced playlists.
Note: Adding local songs to synced/remote playlists is unsupported. Any other combination is valid
Playlists missing? Click here to enable sync read-write mode in settings
This software uses libraries from the FFmpeg project under the LGPLv2.1
Enable to fix some visual issues when Android\'s high contrast mode is enabled
Show playlists for liked and downloaded songs in library
Remove text labels to reduce navbar height
Force a split interface optimized for large screens. This setting has no effect if minimum width requirements are not met
To fully log out, please sign out of your YouTube account in the web portal before using this logout button

This is an ADVANCED login method. As an alternative to the web portal, you may directly enter or update your login token here. For example, this can speed up logging in on multiple devices. Please note that any invalid token formats the app fails to parse will not be accepted
Tap again to copy or edit
Keep all local content, add new remote content
Overwrite local content with remote content
Read write (Also allow changes to remote content)
Automatically sync with your YouTube Music account

Allow gapless offload if supported by the device and audio format. Some devices advertise support (Ex. Google Pixel 9 series), but the feature is good as useless in ExoPlayer because playback breaks after playing one song. When troubleshooting issues with offload, we suggest turning gapless offload off

Use the offload audio path for audio playback. Enabling this may reduce power usage but can lead experience issues with audio playback or post processing. This preference has no effect for unsupported codecs or devices
Use a persistent foreground service to prevent OuterTune from being closed in the background
Restore previous open queue(s) when the app starts
The minimum amount of a song that must be played before it is considered \"played\"
Swipe on a song to add it to "enqueue next" directly after currently playing song
Enables word by word lyric syncing. Requires lyrics format support.
Treat all the lines between sync points as one lyric text
Prioritize resolving local lyric files before using all cloud providers. Turn this off to prioritize cloud providers
Disabling will hide local library from the app
Disable to preserve the file structure as on disk
Are you sure you want to disable local media features? Your library contents will not be affected.
Periodically refresh local media songs and custom downloads folders when opening the app
For local media, automatic scanning does not reload the metadata of existing songs. Use the manual scanner with the rescan checkbox selected if you also wish to refresh metadata.
Select folders on your local storage to scan for songs
All subdirectories will also be affected
Invalid selection. A scan folder cannot be a subdirectory of the download folder, or the download folder itself
By default, the scanner will NOT reload any metadata of existing songs unless you specify otherwise above. Depending on the size of your library, it may take a while.
The local media scanner requires storage permissions to function
Local media and song downloads refresh complete!
Refreshing local media and song download folders…
When enabled, file names will NOT be ignored. Ex. "Song.ogg" will be a different song from "Song.flac". Scanner sensitivity preference will still apply
Match file paths instead of metadata
Disables all smart matching of metadata. This can cause issues if files are moved in your local storage, but allows for the same song in different folders
Take first result provided by YouTube when searching on YouTube is enabled, otherwise match title
The system scanner is faster, but may incorrectly extract some metadata compared to other extractors. Please note that switching scanners won\'t automatically reload the metadata of existing songs.
(BETA) Use MediaStore system scanner and extractors
Use FFmpeg metadata extractor. Please only use the "full" variant of the app. The "core" variant could cause issues with song tracking
Rescan the entire library and reload all songs\' metadata
Try to link local files\' artists with ones on YouTube Music
Are you sure you want to remove all downloads? Only downloads in the main download folder will be removed.
Are you sure you want to clear image cache? All exiting album thumbnails will be removed.
Are you sure you want to clear song cache?
Songs from these folders will only appear in the app if you\'ve played them before or added them to a playlist
Move downloads from the app\'s internal storage to the device\'s external storage
This will migrate ALL internal downloads to \"%s\", and this action cannot be undone. Continue?

Songs are download to the app\'s private internal storage. To download songs to the external storage, you need to choose a folder first. You can add, change or remove folders, or migrate Internal Downloads to External Downloads later in Settings.
Update the database and refresh the download registry if any files or folders have changed
Rescan all download folders now? This can take a few minutes depending on the size of your library.

Internal Downloads are saved in the app’s private storage and aren’t accessible without root. 

External Downloads are saved to your device’s external storage (e.g., /sdcard or micro SD cards) and can be accessed or edited directly with a file explorer. For the External Downloads folder, we recommend choosing an empty folder specifically for song downloads, as OuterTune may modify or delete files in that folder. 

Extra Import folders are read-only and used for loading additional songs. OuterTune will never change or delete files in these folders. You can select these folders in the advanced section. 

When you clear downloads, only internal songs are deleted. External Downloads and Extra Import songs must be removed manually, either through the song’s menu or manually via a file explorer. 

Rescan download folders: Song downloads in the External Downloads and Extra Imports folders are NOT updated automatically. If you manually add, remove, or change files using a file explorer, you may need to rescan the download folders to update the app’s database. This option is available in the advanced section.
An app restart is required for changes to take effect
Pause sharing listen history with YouTube Music
Restoring InnerTune backups are supported, albeit a possibility of anomalies due to technical limitations. Forks are NOT supported.
For fresh installs of the app, custom download and local media scan paths may not work. To resolve this, remove and add them again.
Reveals additional advanced settings intended for development use
Enable swiping horizontally in the player to switch songs
For the best experience, we recommend completing a quick setup to personalize key settings like theme, YouTube account, local media, and downloads.
Play your music files (ex. MP3, OGG, FLAC, etc.)
Keep your music in harmony across devices
Customize how OuterTune looks and what content it shows you.
Sign in to your YouTube Music account to sync and access private account content. This is optional.
Choose folders that contain your music. We\'ll scan them for songs to import.
Choose a song cache size. This can help reduce internet or YouTube API playback issues
Choose a folder where downloaded songs will be saved.
OuterTune is set up and ready to use. Explore your music, discover new tracks, and enjoy the experience!
"No songs found. Invalid M3U file, or no song matches were found"
Search on YouTube Music for songs not found in the app database
